@notice Add auth to an account
@param account Account to add auth to

@notice Remove auth from an account
@param account Account to remove auth from
@notice Checks whether msg.sender can call an authed function*
@notice Disable this contract (normally called by GlobalSettlement)
@notice Join all ERC20 system coins that the treasury has inside SAFEEngine

@notice Transfer surplus stability fees to the surplus receiver. This is here to make sure that the treasury
doesn't accumulate too many fees that it doesn't even need in order to pay for allowances. It ensures
that there are enough funds left in the treasury to account for projected expenses (latest expenses multiplied
by an expense multiplier)

@notice Add auth to an account
@param account Account to add auth to

@notice Remove auth from an account
@param account Account to remove auth from
@notice Checks whether msg.sender can call an authed function*

disableContract().notice: Disable this contract (normally called by GlobalSettlement)

giveFunds(address,uint256).notice: Governance transfers SF to an address

pullFunds(address,address,uint256).notice: Pull stability fees from the treasury (if your allowance permits)

setPerBlockAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Modify an address' per block allowance in order to withdraw SF from the treasury

setTotalAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Modify an address' total allowance in order to withdraw SF from the treasury

takeFunds(address,uint256).notice: Governance takes funds from an address

transferSurplusFunds().notice: Transfer surplus stability fees to the surplus receiver. This is here to make sure that the treasury doesn't accumulate too many fees that it doesn't even need in order to pay for allowances. It ensures that there are enough funds left in the treasury to account for projected expenses (latest expenses multiplied by an expense multiplier)

params.rad: Amount of internal system coins to transfer (a number with 45 decimals)

params.parameter: The name of the contract whose address will be changed
The name of the parameter to modify

params.token: Address of the token to transfer (in this case it must be the address of the ERC20 system coin).             Used only to adhere to a standard for automated, on-chain treasuries
params.wad: Amount of system coins (SF) to transfer (expressed as an 18 decimal number but the contract will transfer internal system coins that have 45 decimals)

params.rad: The per block approved amount of SF to withdraw (number with 45 decimals)
The total approved amount of SF to withdraw (number with 45 decimals)

params.account: Address to take system coins from
params.rad: Amount of internal system coins to take from the account (a number with 45 decimals)
